package.name: horde
package.summary: horde: Securityfixes for cross site scripting problems.
package.description:
This update fixes the following two security issues in the Horde Application Framework: - CVE-2006-3548: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a (1) javascript URI or an external (2) http, (3) https, or (4) ftp URI in the url parameter in services/go.php (aka the dereferrer), (5) a javascript URI in the module parameter in services/help (aka the help viewer), and (6) the name parameter in services/problem.php (aka the problem reporting screen).
- CVE-2006-3549: services/go.php does not properly restrict its image proxy capability, which allows remote attackers to perform "Web tunneling" attacks and use the server as a proxy via (1) http, (2) https, and (3) ftp URL in the url parameter, which is requested from the server.
